allergies:
Peanuts – causes swelling of lips and breathing difficulty
Ibuprofen – causes stomach pain
diagnoses:
Asthma (childhood onset)
Generalised anxiety (mild, under GP care)
medications:
Salbutamol inhaler (blue) – 2 puffs when wheezy, up to 4 times per day
Budesonide inhaler (brown) – 1 puff twice daily as preventer
Sertraline 50 mg – once daily in the morning
notes:
Non-smoker, lives with flatmate, works in an office.
Asthma usually well-controlled; flare-ups during cold weather or chest infections.
Carries two salbutamol inhalers (one in bag, one at home).
Peanut allergy is severe – carries an adrenaline auto-injector prescribed by allergy clinic.
Anxiety improves with medication and regular exercise (yoga twice a week).
